  - README.md exists with project description, usage examples, and DSL syntax reference

## PRD Summary
A command-line tool that accepts a custom DSL for defining architecture diagrams, compiles it to production-quality SVG output, and provides an ASCII-art preview mode for rapid iteration in the terminal. The DSL supports nodes (services, databases, external systems), connections with labels, and layout hints. The tool validates DSL syntax, reports meaningful errors, and generates clean, scalable SVG graphics suitable for embedding in documentation.

Acceptance Criteria:
- cargo build --release && cargo test --all && cargo clippy -- -D warnings && cargo fmt -- --check && test -f Cargo.toml && test -d src/ && test -f src/main.rs
- cargo build --release && ./target/release/diagrams --help | grep -q 'compile' && ./target/release/diagrams --help | grep -q 'preview' && ./target/release/diagrams compile --help | grep -q 'output' && ./target/release/diagrams preview --help | grep -q 'input'
- echo 'node "API" as api
node "DB" as db
api -> db : "SQL query"' > /tmp/test_diagram.dsl && cargo run --release -- compile /tmp/test_diagram.dsl -o /tmp/output.svg && test -f /tmp/output.svg && head -1 /tmp/output.svg | grep -q '<svg' && xmllint --noout /tmp/output.svg
- echo 'node "API" as api
node "DB" as db
api -> db : "query"' > /tmp/test_diagram.dsl && cargo run --release -- preview /tmp/test_diagram.dsl | grep -qE '[\u2500-\u257F]'
- echo 'invalid syntax here' > /tmp/invalid.dsl && cargo run --release -- compile /tmp/invalid.dsl -o /tmp/out.svg 2>&1 | grep -qi 'syntax error' && ! cargo run --release -- compile /tmp/invalid.dsl -o /tmp/out.svg
- echo 'node "Service A" as svc_a
node "Service B" as svc_b
svc_a -> svc_b : "HTTP"' > /tmp/test.dsl && cargo run --release -- compile /tmp/test.dsl -o /tmp/test.svg && grep -q 'Service A' /tmp/test.svg && grep -q 'Service B' /tmp/test.svg && grep -q 'HTTP' /tmp/test.svg
- for i in {1..100}; do echo "node \"Node$i\" as n$i"; done > /tmp/large.dsl && for i in {1..99}; do j=$((i+1)); echo "n$i -> n$j"; done >> /tmp/large.dsl && hyperfine --warmup 3 --runs 10 'cargo run --release -- compile /tmp/large.dsl -o /tmp/large.svg' --export-json /tmp/perf.json && mean=$(jq '.results[0].mean' /tmp/perf.json) && awk -v m="$mean" 'BEGIN {exit !(m < 1.0)}'
- cargo build --release && size=$(stat -f%z target/release/diagrams) && test "$size" -lt 10485760
- cargo test --lib parser 2>&1 | grep -q 'test result: ok' && test $(cargo test --lib parser -- --list | grep -c 'test') -ge 5
- cargo test --test integration
- ! grep -r 'unsafe' src/ --include='*.rs'
- cargo doc --no-deps 2>&1 | grep -q 'Documenting diagrams' && ! cargo doc --no-deps 2>&1 | grep -i 'warning'

## Architecture Summary
A clean, three-layer Rust CLI architecture that transforms DSL into SVG diagrams with ASCII preview. The design emphasizes separation of concerns, testability, and parallel development through 8 independent modules with explicit interfaces. Data flows unidirectionally: DSL text → AST → Layout → Output Format. Foundation types are built first, enabling parallel development of parsing, layout, and rendering streams.
